page.title: 03HISTORY 2/EDUCATION
page.content: In 1834 Sir Henry Tufton Endowed Hothfield with a school for boys & girls which was completed in 1839 & opened in 1840. The building no longer being adequate, a new school was built in 1874 alongside; the old school was then used as a residence for heads or staff at a nominal rent. In 1974 the rent was Â£60.00 pa. The classrooms & above rooms on each side of the main house were separated & sold. The main house was sold in 1975. Numbers on roll at the school were 40 in 1840 rising to 140 recently & has now dropped to 60. Westwell school is no longer used & has been sold.
